body_html:
I'm somewhat confused about why people are running into this now when our Mac tests aren't failing. It looks like it's fixed with python/cpython@98ba455 (https://bugs.python.org/issue10910). Does 2.7.10 not have that fix? Can you upgrade?

If we do need a workaround, what about:

#undef isalnum
#undef isalpha
#undef islower
#undef isspace
#undef isupper
#undef tolower
#undef toupper

I'm somewhat confused about why people are running into this now when our Mac tests aren't failing. It looks like it's fixed with python/cpython@98ba455 (https://bugs.python.org/issue10910). Does 2.7.10 not have that fix? Can you upgrade?
If we do need a workaround, what about:
#undef isalnum
#undef isalpha
#undef islower
#undef isspace
#undef isupper
#undef tolower
#undef toupper
body:
I'm somewhat confused about why people are running into this now when our Mac tests aren't failing. It looks like it's fixed with https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/98ba455b9afe3fa78751ecae2e9d29f1ba82e7f7 (https://bugs.python.org/issue10910). Does 2.7.10 not have that fix? Can you upgrade?

If we do need a workaround, what about:

```
#undef isalnum
#undef isalpha
#undef islower
#undef isspace
#undef isupper
#undef tolower
#undef toupper
```
